titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Frederick H. Sheldon was Assistant and then Associate Curator of Birds at the Academy of Natural Sciences from 1987 to 1993. His primary interests are the evolution and systematics of birds, and the natural history of the birds of the Malay archipelago.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of professional papers of Frederick H. Sheldon. Materials include: letters of appointment, promotion and annual reviews; professional correspondence, much of it with colleagues in other institutions; general administrative correspondence related to the American Ornithologists' Union and their publication, The Auk; and photocopies of field notes from trips to Malaysia, South Africa, Greece, and Australia. The collection also includes documents related to allegations made by Vincent Sarich and colleagues against Charles Sibley and Jon Ahlquist and their work with DNA hybridization. Materials include: correspondence, drafts sent for review, data, and articles.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
